Get occurrence data from GBIF

Source: R/getData.R
getData.Rd

Use rgbif to retrieve occurrence data from GBIF's database for a given taxon. This function will only return occurrences that include GPS coordinates.

Usage

getData(key, limit = 100, geometry = NULL)

Arguments

key

The taxon key for the taxon of interest (can be found using SSARP::getKey)

limit

The maximum number of occurrence records to return. Default: 100. NOTE: there is a hard maximum of 100,000 (see more information about the limit in rgbif::occ_search)

geometry

A counter-clockwise winding order well-known text (WKT) representation of geometry for use in the rgbif::occ_search call. This parameter will restrict returned occurrence records to the specified geometry. More information about valid WKT objects can be found in the rgbif::occ_search vignette.

Value

A dataframe of occurrence records for the taxon of interest

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
dat <- getData(key = 2447418, limit = 1000)

# With geometry that restricts returned Anolis data to a box around Florida
# (Includes some records in Georgia and the Biminis due to the size of the square)
dat <- getData(key = 8782549, 
              limit = 1000, 
              geometry = 'POLYGON((-87.4 24.3, -79.2 24.3, -79.2 31.1, -87.4 31.1, -87.4 24.3))')
} # }
